titles.title: Providing for consideration of a certain motion to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-452, by Mr. Frost.

Rule provides for consideration of S. 349. Upon the adoption of this resolution it shall be in order at any time on the legislative day of Thursday, Mar. 24, 1994, for the Speaker to entertain a motion that the House suspend the rules and pass the bill S. 394 as amended, and that the House insist upon its amendment thereto, and request a conference with the Senate thereon.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 144.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 202 (Roll no. 89).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/23/1994--Introduced. Makes it in order for the Speaker, at any time on the legislative day of March 24, 1994, to entertain a motion that the House suspend the rules and pass S. 349 (providing for the disclosure of lobbying activities to influence the Federal Government) as amended, insist on the House amendment thereto, and request a conference with the Senate thereon.
